relationships.description: Email correspondence between Epstein and Staley discussing political matters
Former White House counsel trusted by the president

analysis.purpose: Acknowledgment of received information about potential Attorney General candidate
analysis.significance: Shows Epstein sharing political intelligence with business associate Jes Staley

notable_quotes: Administration officials were firm that President Obama was only beginning to think about a new attorney general, but many in Washington are already focusing on Kathryn Ruemmler
She is one of only three women to serve as White House counsel
If Ms. Ruemmler is nominated, the advice she dispensed to the White House about the I.R.S. scandal and the attacks on Benghazi, Libya, will certainly draw scrutiny
red_flags: Sharing of political intelligence from Epstein to banking executive

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this communication

illegal_activity.description: Document contains shared news/article content about political appointments, not first-hand illegal activity

public_knowledge.context: Discussion of potential Attorney General appointments during Obama administration was public political news

analysis.summary: Jeffrey Epstein shares political intelligence about potential Attorney General candidate Kathryn Ruemmler with Jes Staley, who briefly acknowledges receiving the information with a simple 'I saw that' response.
